title: Walgreens, Walmart and CVS Pharmacies Contributed to Opioid Epidemic, Ohio Jury Finds
sub_head: Two counties in state argued the pharmacy chains created a public nuisance by enabling the opioid crisis
body:
A federal jury in Cleveland found that the companies that own CVS, Walgreens and Walmart pharmacies were liable for contributing to the opioid epidemic in two Ohio counties, a potentially influential verdict among the thousands of cases filed against pharmacy chains.
Attorneys for Lake and Trumbull counties in northeast Ohio had argued the chains failed to stop pain pills from flooding the counties or stop false prescriptions from being filled.
